/wiki/Nasuh_Akar: Nasuh Akar (10 May 1925 – 18 May 1984) was a Turkish sports wrestler, who won the gold medal in the Bantamweight class of Men's Freestyle category at the 1948 Olympics.
/wiki/Wrestling_at_the_1948_Summer_Olymp: At the 1948 Summer Olympics, 16 wrestling events were contested, for all men. There were eight weight classes in Greco-Roman wrestling and eight classes in freestyle wrestling. The freestyle competitions were held from July 29 to July 31, 1948 and the Greco-Roman events were held from August 3 to August 6, 1948.
/wiki/Gazanfer_Bilge: Gazanfer Bilge (July 23, 1924 – April 20, 2008) was a Turkish sports wrestler who won the gold medal in the Featherweight class of Men's Freestyle Wrestling at the 1948 Olympics.
/wiki/Celal_Atik: Celal Atik (1920 – 27 April 1979) was a Turkish wrestler and coach. He competed both in Greco-Roman and freestyle wrestling, but had his best achievements in the freestyle, winning gold medals at the 1948 Olympics, 1951 World and 1946 and 1949 European championships.
/wiki/Yasar_Dogu: Yaşar Doğu (1913 – 8 January 1961), was a renowned Turkish World and Olympic champion sports wrestler in Greco-Roman and Freestyle.
/wiki/Ahmet_Kire%C3%A7%C3%A7i: Ahmet Kireççi (aka Ahmet Mersinli, 27 October 1914 in Mersin – 17 August 1978 in Mersin, Turkey), was a Turkish sports wrestler, who won the Olympic medal twice, the bronze medal in the Middleweight class of Men's Freestyle Wrestling at the 1936 Olympics and the gold medal in the Heavyweight class of Men's Greco-Roman category at the 1948 Olympics.
/wiki/Mehmet_Oktav: Mehmet Oktav (1917 in Istanbul, Turkey – 1996)  was a Turkish sports wrestler, who became Olympic gold medalist for Turkey in the Featherweight class of Men's Greco-Roman Wrestling in 1948.
/wiki/Halit_Balamir: Halit Balamir (1922 – 2 March 2009) was a Turkish sport wrestler. He was born in Gümüşhane He won a silver medal in freestyle wrestling, flyweight class, at the 1948 Summer Olympics in London.
/wiki/Adil_Candemir: Adil Candemir (1917– died 12 January 1989) was a Turkish sport wrestler. He was born in Amasya. He won a silver medal in freestyle wrestling, middleweight class, at the 1948 Summer Olympics in London.
/wiki/Kenan_Olcay: Kenan Olcay (born 30 november 1913, date of death unknown) was a Greco-Roman wrestler from Turkey. He won a silver medal in the flyweight class at the 1948 Olympics.
/wiki/Muhlis_Tayfur: Muhlis Tayfur (1922–21 July 2008) was a Turkish sport wrestler, born in Erzurum. He won a silver medal in Greco-Roman wrestling, middleweight class, at the 1948 Summer Olympics in London.
/wiki/Halil_Kaya: Halil Kaya (born 1920, date of death unknown) was a Turkish sport wrestler. He won a bronze medal in Greco-Roman wrestling, bantamweight class, at the 1948 Summer Olympics in London.
/wiki/Ruhi_Sar%C4%B1alp: Ruhi Sarıalp (December 15, 1924  – March 3, 2001) was a Turkish track and field athlete, who competed mainly in the triple jump. He was born in Manisa.
/wiki/Athletics_at_the_1948_Summer_Olymp: At the 1948 Summer Olympics in London, 33 athletics events were contested, 24 for men and 9 for women. Three events made their Olympic debut at these Games: women's 200 metres, women's long jump and women's shot put. There were a total number of 745 participating athletes from 53 countries.
